title: Tensions Mount As Trump Administration Threatens Federal Crackdown in Chicago
summary: In a social media post, President Trump said Chicago was “about to find out why it’s called the Department of WAR.” Illinois officials condemned the message.

title: Immigration Raid on Hyundai-LG Plant in Georgia Rattles South Korea
summary: The country said it had sent diplomats to the site, and South Korea’s foreign minister said he might travel to Washington himself to address the matter.

title: A Mysterious Death Casts a Shadow Over Burning Man
summary: This year’s desert arts and music event reached a fever pitch before a Russian man was found in a pool of his own blood. Authorities said his death is being treated as a homicide.

title: President of Peace, Department of War. A New Name Sends Mixed Signals.
summary: President Trump’s renaming of the Defense Department comes amid his overt campaign for a Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Chicago on Edge After Threats of ICE Raids
summary: President Trump is threatening the third-largest U.S. city with “Chipocalypse Now” and mass deportations.

title: A World War II Dispute Between Ukraine and Poland Is Put to Rest
summary: The remains of people killed and left in mass graves in the waning days of the war are being given dignified burials.

title: Air Canada Flight Attendants Overwhelmingly Reject Proposed Contract
summary: But the vote will not lead to a repeat of the walkout that snarled air travel in Canada last month.

title: Authorities Point to Cable Disconnecting in First Report on Lisbon Funicular Crash
summary: Portuguese authorities released a highly anticipated preliminary report into the disaster, which killed 16 people this week.

title: ICE Has Begun Immigration Crackdown in Massachusetts
summary: The operation includes Boston, whose mayor has drawn the administration’s ire for speaking out against the growing scale of its immigration actions.

title: Thrust Into the Line of Fire, Iranians Worry About What Comes Next
summary: A 12-day war in June upended the shadow war rivalry between Israel and Iran. Some Iranians want to strike back, others want to move on.

title: ‘Father Mother Sister Brother’ Takes Top Prize at Venice Film Festival
summary: The film, directed by Jim Jarmusch, details three stories of three families. “The Voice of Hind Rajab,” about a Palestinian girl in a car under fire by the Israeli military, won second place.

title: Justice Breyer Defends Judge Accused of Defying Supreme Court Order
summary: The justice’s comments reflected tensions within the judiciary, as trial judges struggle to interpret the Supreme Court’s often cryptic emergency orders.

title: At Least 425 Pro-Palestinian Protesters Arrested in London on Terrorism Charges
summary: The demonstrators oppose the British government’s decision to designate Palestine Action as a terrorist organization.

title: Lottery Winners Share Hard Lessons Ahead of $1.8 Billion Powerball Drawing
summary: Past jackpot winners recall fortunes found, mistakes made and advice for those holding a lucky ticket.

title: Bernie Sanders to Host Zohran Mamdani at Fighting Oligarchy Event in Brooklyn
summary: Mr. Sanders will host the Democratic front-runner for mayor of New York City at a town hall in Brooklyn on Saturday night. The two marched in a Labor Day parade that morning in Manhattan.

title: In India’s Rebound From Trump Blows, Modi Has No Easy Choices
summary: The unraveling of relations between the United States and India has convinced many Indian officials that the country should return to its difficult balancing act of nonalignment.

title: Throwaway Plastic Has Corrupted Us
summary: Disposable plastics have profoundly reshaped the way we eat, shop, raise children and understand hygiene and progress.

title: On College Campuses, Students Weigh the Risk of Resistance
summary: University administrations are under pressure from the Trump administration to discourage pro-Palestinian demonstrations.

title: Divorce Plunged in Kentucky. Equal Custody for Fathers Is a Big Reason Why.
summary: Kentucky’s law setting the standard of 50-50 shared child custody was hailed as a victory for fathers’ rights. Critics say it also puts mothers and children at risk.

title: Men + Women + Apps = Bad Romance
summary: The two sexes are looking past each other.

title: Trump’s War on Wind Has This Construction Crew Stuck 15 Miles Out at Sea
summary: A $5 billion wind farm project off the New England coast was 80% complete when it got the stop-work from the Trump administration. A small army of workers and suppliers are in limbo.

title: Grand Juries in D.C. Reject Wave of Charges Under Trump’s Crackdown
summary: The persistent rejections suggest that the grand jurors may have had enough of prosecutors seeking harsh charges in a highly politicized environment.

title: What’s Inside the Envelope That U.S. Open Winners Get? It’s Not a Check.
summary: Both singles champions will win $5 million. But the envelope they receive during the trophy presentation is a symbolic gesture.

title: Settlement Talks Stall Between Harvard and the Trump Administration
summary: One major reason is said to be an emerging divide within the administration over whether the current framework is too favorable to Harvard.

title: George Mason’s President, Gregory Washington, Will Not Apologize to the Trump Administration
summary: Gregory Washington, George Mason’s first Black president, runs a university that prizes diversity. That has made him a target of the Trump administration.

title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene is walking a tightrope: splitting with the White House on the release of Epstein files while trying not to cross President Trump or his supporters
summary: The Georgia congresswoman and Trump loyalist is urging the president to meet with victims and back a House vote on document disclosure.

title: Inside Iran After the 12-Day War
summary: Following a 12-day war with Israel in July, which resulted in the deaths of over 1,000 civilians and many of Iran’s top nuclear scientists and officials, a New York Times team was granted access to Tehran. Declan Walsh, a Times international correspondent, explains how the conflict has created a widespread sense of uncertainty and flux in the Iranian capital.

title: A Japanese Island Preserves an Ancient and Ghostly Theater Form
summary: Noh was once the entertainment of medieval warriors. Today, remote Sado Islanders embrace one of the world’s oldest surviving types of drama.

title: President Trump signed an executive order to rebrand the Department of Defense as the Department of War, reviving a name that was last used in 1947
summary: Under the executive order, the name is set to be the agency’s secondary title until Congress approves the new name.

title: The Campaign to Get Eric Adams to Drop His Re-Election Bid
summary: The New York City mayor vows he will continue to seek another term, but he faces pressure from business leaders and the Trump administration.

title: Hundreds Arrested in Immigration Raid at Hyundai Site in Georgia
summary: South Korea said it had expressed concerns to the U.S. about the raid and that it was trying to secure the release of its citizens.

title: Opinion | Can Trump’s ‘War Department’ Win a War?
summary: What matters isn’t the name but the erosion of U.S. hard power.

title: Opinion | The Trump Summer Jobs Stall
summary: Most businesses have stopped new hiring as tariffs add costs and uncertainty, the latest jobs report confirms.

title: Opinion | Another College President Quits
summary: Northwestern’s leader, who made a deal with the campus mob, is out.

title: Opinion | Illegal School Strikes in Washington
summary: A walkout that state law says shouldn’t happen at Evergreen Public Schools halts class for 22,000.

title: Opinion | The Unbearable Ubiquity of Trump
summary: His presence is so constant that a long weekend without an appearance sparked rumors of his death.

title: Opinion | A New Jersey Family May Lose the Farm to Eminent Domain
summary: Cranbury residents are irate about the township’s plan to seize private land and hand it to a developer.

title: Powerball Hits $1.8 Billion. Here Are the 10 Biggest U.S. Lottery Jackpots.
summary: The most recent Powerball jackpot increased to $1.8 billion. Changes to Powerball and Mega Millions have led to increasingly large jackpots in recent years.

title: Texas Bans Summer Camp Cabins in Flood Plains
summary: State lawmakers passed the package of bills following deadly floods in July.

title: The Florida immigration detention facility known as Alligator Alcatraz can stay open after a federal appeals court put on hold a decision that would have seen much of the facility dismantled
summary: An appeals-court ruling puts on hold a lower-court decision that would have dismantled much of the facility.

title: ‘The Highest Exam’ Review: China’s Big Test
summary: Students who sit for college-entrance exams in China have reached the culmination of years of preparation. The outcome can have far-reaching effects.
